hypothesis_content.title: Post-Schiff-Dump BTC Long
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a public, bearish price declaration from noted crypto-critic Peter Schiff (e.g., 'Bitcoin won't go up'), BTC will experience a short-term bullish reaction, rising an average of 3% more than the broader crypto market (represented by TOTALCAP) over the following 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Schiff's commentary is a consistent contrary indicator. His pronouncements often mark localized sentiment lows, triggering buy-the-dip behavior from the crypto-native cohort who view his skepticism as a bullish signal. Using relative strength vs. TOTALCAP isolates the 'Schiff effect' from general market moves.
entry_conditions: Major financial news outlet publishes a direct, bearish BTC price quote from Peter Schiff
Entry at the next daily candle open following news confirmation
BTC must be in a NEUTRAL or BULL regime per FjordHQ's regime filter at time of entry

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC outperforms TOTALCAP by 3% (e.g., BTC +2%, TOTALCAP -1% = 3% alpha)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The median 5-day BTC/TOTALCAP performance following a verified Schiff bearish statement is ≤ 0% (i.e., no consistent alpha or negative alpha).
